result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent M Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 12-16-15 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent M Malone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent M Malone in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 days in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 12-16-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Vincent M Malone in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel did not have matter scheduled today and requested a short adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent M Malone in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija. by phone  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Clerk was contacted by attorney Gabriella Leija advising that there are no motion issues on this matter and requested that the motion hearing date be changed to a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing scheduled on August 6, 2015 at 3:00 pm in Branch 24.

Defendant Vincent M Malone in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a motion hearing date.  Court ordered defense motion to be filed by May 18, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24..  Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/27/2015

$300 bail to be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vincent M Malone in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/31/15 @ 1:30 pm
